snippet: The European Central Bank said 800 banks snapped up 530 billion euros, or $713 billion, in new three-year loans, more than the last round, easing fears of a credit crunch.
abstract: European Central Bank says 800 euro zone banks borrowed 529.5 billion euros ($713 billion) in new three-year loans, compared to 489 billion in December's offer, easing fears of a credit crunch.
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank said 800 banks snapped up 530 billion euros, or $713 billion, in new three-year loans, more than the last round, easing fears of a credit crunch.

headline.main: European Banks Flock to 2nd Round of Cheap Loans
headline.print_headline: Central Bank Extends More Low-Interest Loans
